intro: Lippomuellera, commonly known as the mountain heath, is a genus of flowering plants native to Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plants typically have small, leathery leaves and produce clusters of white or pink flowers. Lippomuellera species are often found in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid regions. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and ecological importance in native habitats.
